title: Can you check contacts for cable joints too?

content.raw:
I'm finding that the solar array cable joints are far more potent that I would expect; they often get caught up on the array, and bind in surprising ways.

The attached picture is of the cable, fastened to the solar array.  Moving the hand up or left or right would not dislodge the cable.  You can see in the picture that the array is being lifted into the air by the connecting cable joint.

Could this be a 'trimesh-trimesh' contact issue as well?
content.html:
I'm finding that the solar array cable joints are far more potent that I would expect; they often get caught up on the array, and bind in surprising ways.

The attached picture is of the cable, fastened to the solar array. Moving the hand up or left or right would not dislodge the cable. You can see in the picture that the array is being lifted into the air by the connecting cable joint.

Could this be a 'trimesh-trimesh' contact issue as well?
